scope: Attic, closet, and perimeter spaces on accessible floors of a structure
applicability: Counts toward Gross Floor Area (GFA) regardless of depiction on the floor plan
Counts toward GFA regardless of actual usage of the space
exclusions: Subject to exemption criteria specified in Rule 2 (historic homes attic exemption)
notes: Voluminous spaces contribute to GFA even if not used or not depicted on the floor plan

ambiguity_flags.text: Meaning of 'accessible floors' is not defined (e.g., does it require permanent stair/elevator access or any access?).
ambiguity_flags.impact: Eligibility for counting could vary depending on access definition.

Variables.name: head_clearance
Variables.description: Vertical clear height of the area being evaluated

Variables.name: floor_accessible
Variables.description: Indicates whether the floor is considered accessible for the purpose of GFA counting
Variables.ambiguity_notes: Accessibility criteria not defined; example suggests 'accessible via stairs'.

Variables.name: floor_level
Variables.description: Designated floor on which the area physically resides

Variables.name: depicted_on_floor_plan
Variables.description: Whether the area is shown on the submitted floor plan
Variables.validation_note: This variable does not affect counting under this rule.

Variables.name: actual_usage
Variables.description: Actual use of the space (e.g., storage, mechanical, circulation)
Variables.validation_note: Usage does not affect counting under this rule.

Constants.name: HEAD_CLEARANCE_THRESHOLD
Constants.source: Page 22 main rule text and Figure 11 dimension

Constants.name: M-001
Constants.description: Measure head clearance vertically from top of floor to underside of the rafter.

Constants.name: CODE_REFERENCE_1
Constants.description: Referenced code section; details not provided in excerpt

Constants.name: CODE_REFERENCE_2
Constants.description: Referenced code section; details not provided in excerpt

Conditions.logic: IF floor_accessible == true AND head_clearance >= HEAD_CLEARANCE_THRESHOLD THEN include area in GFA_count
Conditions.outcome: Area is included in Gross Floor Area

Conditions.logic: Assignment of included area to floor level equals the floor_level where the area physically resides.
Conditions.outcome: Counted area is attributed to its corresponding floor (e.g., 3rd floor areas count toward 3rd floor GFA; 2nd floor areas count toward 2nd floor GFA).
Conditions.source: Derived from Figure 11 examples (Areas A and B)

Conditions.logic: depicted_on_floor_plan and actual_usage do not affect inclusion if C-1 is satisfied.
Conditions.outcome: Inclusion in GFA is independent of plan depiction and usage.

Exceptions.description: Historic homes attic exemption may reduce counted area
Exceptions.effect: Allows up to 500 sf of qualifying unusable attic space to be excluded from GFA counting

cross_references.description: Illustrates counted areas A (3rd floor) and B (2nd floor) and the 5' head clearance threshold
Mentioned as addressing how these areas count toward GFA; details not provided in excerpt

overrides_and_exceptions.scope: Qualifying unusable attic spaces in Category 1 & 2 historic homes up to 500 sf

ambiguity_flags.text: Term 'unusable attic space' is not defined.
ambiguity_flags.impact: Unclear criteria for what qualifies as unusable may affect eligibility.

ambiguity_flags.text: Whether the 500 sf cap is per building, per property, per project, or per attic is not specified.
ambiguity_flags.impact: Ambiguity in how the exemption limit is applied could lead to inconsistent application.

ambiguity_flags.text: Criteria or authority for defining 'Category 1 & 2 historic homes' is not provided.
ambiguity_flags.impact: Requires external classification standard or documentation.

Variables.name: area_type
Variables.description: This exemption applies only to attic spaces

Variables.name: usability_status
Variables.description: Determines whether the attic space qualifies for the exemption
Variables.ambiguity_notes: No criteria for 'unusable' provided in excerpt.

Variables.name: exemptible_area
Variables.description: Portion of qualifying attic area proposed to be excluded from GFA

Conditions.logic: IF building_category IN {'Category 1 historic home','Category 2 historic home'} AND area_type == 'attic' AND usability_status == 'unusable' THEN up to ATTIC_EXEMPTION_CAP may be excluded from GFA.
Conditions.outcome: Optional reduction of GFA count from Rule 1 by up to 500 sf.
Conditions.notes: Administrator may require documentation establishing 'unusable' status and historic category.

overrides_and_exceptions.scope: Unusable attic space in Category 1 & 2 historic homes up to 500 sf

cross_references.description: Source statement for the 500 sf exemption
